intro: Siphocampylus argentinus var. hirticorollinus, commonly known as the hairy corolla siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated.
